subject: Negotiation
title: The Thomas-Kilmann Conflict Modes
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Thomas-Kilmann Conflict Modes usable.

hook.text: There are five ways to handle conflict â€” and most people default to the same one every time.

buildup.text: Competing, collaborating, compromising, avoiding, and accommodating â€” each has a time and place.

discovery.text: Thomas and Kilmann mapped these on two axes: assertiveness and cooperativeness.

twist.text: No single mode is best. The skill is choosing the right mode for each specific situation.

climax.text: People who can flex across all five modes resolve conflicts faster and with less damage.

punchline.text: Know all five styles. Use the one the situation demands.
